text: The men's coxless four competition at the 2018 World Rowing Championships in Plovdiv took place at the Plovdiv Regatta Venue. ==Schedule== The schedule was as follows: {| class="wikitable" ! Date ! Time ! Round |- | Sunday 9 September 2018 || 16:19 || Heats |- | Tuesday 11 September 2018 || 11:21 || Repechages |- | rowspan=2|Thursday 13 September 2018 || 12:30 || Semifinals A/B |- | 15:33 || Semifinals C/D |- | rowspan=4|Saturday 15 September 2018 || 10:18 || Final B |- | style=background:lemonchiffon| 12:46 ||style=background:lemonchiffon| Final A |- | 15:17 || Final C |- | 16:05 || Final D |} All times are Eastern European Summer Time (UTC+3) ==Results== ===Heats=== The two fastest boats in each heat advanced directly to the A/B semifinals. The remaining boats were sent to the repechages. ====Heat 1==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time !Notes |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 1 | align="left"|Bjorn van den Ende 6:07.85 | R |} ===Repechages=== The two fastest boats in each repechage advanced to the A/B semifinals. The remaining boats were sent to the C/D semifinals. ====Repechage 1==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time !Notes |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 1 | align="left"|Vadzim Lialin Dzmitry Vyberanets Ihar Pashevich Mikalai Sharlap | align="left"| | 5:50.90 | SA/B |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 2 | align="left"|Maksym Boklazhenko Dmytro Hula Vladyslav Bogoiavlenskyi Oleksii Tymoshenko | align="left"| | 5:51.56 | SA/B |- | 3 | align="left"|Angus McFarlane Matthew MacDonald Thomas Mackintosh Thomas Russel | align="left"| | 5:53.09 | SC/D |- | 4 | align="left"|Steffen Jensen Toger Rasmussen Joachim Sutton Tobias Kempf | align="left"| | 5:54.28 | SC/D |- | 5 | align="left"|Maksim Golubev Semen Yaganov Ivan Balandin Daniil Andrienko | align="left"| | 5:56.51 | SC/D |- | 6 | align="left"|Nelson Martínez Francisco Lapostol Ignacio Abraham Oscar Vasquez | align="left"| | 5:58.68 | SC/D |} ====Repechage 2==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time !Notes |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 1 | align="left"|Jakub Grabmüller Matyáš Klang Petr Melichar Matej Tikal | align="left"| | 5:52.87 | SA/B |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 2 | align="left"|Paul Jacquot Markus Kessler Augustin Maillefer Benjamin Hirsch | align="left"| | 5:53.47 | SA/B |- | 3 | align="left"|Alexander Richards Michael Clougher Nicholas Mead Dariush Aghai | align="left"| | 5:56.07 | SC/D |- | 4 | align="left"|Benoit Demey Edouard Jonville Sean Vedrinelle Benoît Brunet | align="left"| | 5:56.23 | SC/D |- | 5 | align="left"|Florian Walk Maximilian Kohlmayr Rudolph Querfeld Gabriel Hohensasser | align="left"| | 6:06.55 | SC/D |} ===Semifinals C/D=== All but the slowest boat in each semi were sent to the C final. The slowest boats were sent to the D final. ====Semifinal 1==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time !Notes |- | 1 | align="left"|Florian Walk Maximilian Kohlmayr Rudolph Querfeld Gabriel Hohensasser | align="left"| | 6:05.67 | FC |- | 2 | align="left"|Benoit Demey Edouard Jonville Sean Vedrinelle Benoît Brunet | align="left"| | 6:07.85 | FC |- | 3 | align="left"|Angus McFarlane Matthew MacDonald Thomas Mackintosh Thomas Russel | align="left"| | 6:07.91 | FC |- | 4 | align="left"|Nelson Martínez Francisco Lapostol Ignacio Abraham Oscar Vasquez | align="left"| | 6:12.47 | FD |} ====Semifinal 2==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time !Notes |- | 1 | align="left"|Alexander Richards Michael Clougher Nicholas Mead Dariush Aghai | align="left"| | 6:02.40 | FC |- | 2 | align="left"|Maksim Golubev Semen Yaganov Ivan Balandin Daniil Andrienko | align="left"| | 6:05.05 | FC |- | 3 | align="left"|Steffen Jensen Toger Rasmussen Joachim Sutton Tobias Kempf | align="left"| | 6:08.78 | FD |} ===Semifinals A/B=== The three fastest boats in each semi advanced to the A final. The remaining boats were sent to the B final. ====Semifinal 1==== {|class="wikitable" style="text- align:center" !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time !Notes |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 1 | align="left"|Joshua Hicks Spencer Turrin Jack Hargreaves Alexander Hill | align="left"| | 5:57.99 | FA |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 2 | align="left"|Bjorn van den Ende Tone Wieten Jasper Tissen Bram Schwarz | align="left"| | 5:58.84 | FA |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 3 | align="left"|Mihăiță Vasile Țigănescu Cosmin Pascari Ştefan-Constantin Berariu Ciprian Huc | align="left"| | 6:00.08 | FA |- | 4 | align="left"|Zbigniew Schodowski Mateusz Wilangowski Mikołaj Burda Michał Szpakowski | align="left"| | 6:04.00 | FB |- | 5 | align="left"|Vadzim Lialin Dzmitry Vyberanets Ihar Pashevich Mikalai Sharlap | align="left"| | 6:15.85 | FB |- | 6 | align="left"|Paul Jacquot Markus Kessler Augustin Maillefer Benjamin Hirsch | align="left"| | 6:17.04 | FB |} ====Semifinal 2==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time !Notes |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 1 | align="left"|Matteo Castaldo Bruno Rosetti Matteo Lodo Marco Di Costanzo | align="left"| | 6:01.74 | FA |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 2 | align="left"|Thomas Ford Jacob Dawson Adam Neill James Johnston | align="left"| | 6:03.40 | FA |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 3 | align="left"|Felix Brummel Nico Merget Peter Kluge Felix Drahotta | align="left"| | 6:04.44 | FA |- | 4 | align="left"|Kyle Schoonbee David Hunt John Smith Sandro Torrente | align="left"| | 6:08.00 | FB |- | 5 | align="left"|Jakub Grabmüller Matyáš Klang Petr Melichar Matej Tikal | align="left"| | 6:11.39 | FB |- | 6 | align="left"|Maksym Boklazhenko Dmytro Hula Vladyslav Bogoiavlenskyi Oleksii Tymoshenko | align="left"| | 6:24.18 | FB |} ===Finals=== The A final determined the rankings for places 1 to 6.
